data.title: DEFINE
questions: In this phase, determine the problem to be solved.
Define the problem as a question. Post/write it down.
Ensure the framing satisfies all parties/interest groups.
Keep focused on this question throughout the process.
Determine criteria by which solutions will be evaluated.
If necessary, weight the criteria with percentages totaling 1.

data.title: CLARIFY
questions: In this phase, establish the data relevant to the problem.
Establish ‘what is’: gather all the relevant data.
Exclude any inferences, interpretations, opinions, etc.
What are the verifiable facts? What is known?
What exactly is the situation now? What is the current state?
How static or evolving is the problem? Improving? Worsening?
What is currently working? What’s not working? Why?
What seem to be the root causes of the present state?
Why is the present situation or solution unworkable?

data.title: EXPLORE
questions: In this phase, explore possible ways of solving the problem.
How might the data be interpreted? What can be inferred?
What is this problem similar or analogous to?
What insights/hunches come to mind about the data?
What patterns/trends are suggested by the data?
How would we solve this if there were no constraints?
What potential answers have been ruled out?
Imagine all parties are satisfied: what would that look like?
Remember to suspend judgment (positive or negative) in brainstorming…
Brainstorm ideas or ways of answering the question.

data.title: EVALUATE
questions: In this phase, evaluate possible solutions and reach consensus on the best few.
Vote (each person gets 3 votes) to rank the most favored solutions.
What interests or needs are satisfied by each solution? Which are not?
Where is the most common ground on which to build?
How might two or more solutions be consolidated?
How might conflicting interests be resolved?
How might opposing groups collaborate to reach a consensus?
What solutions could all parties support—even if not in full agreement?
Specify all needs met and unmet with the proposed solutions.

data.title: ANALYZE + SOLVE
questions: In this phase, select the best solution and plan how to implement it.
Analyze each solution against the criteria agreed to upfront.
Establish ratings for each solution based on verified data.
Determine and weigh the pros/cons of the highest-rated solution.
Acknowledge consequences if not an ideal solution.
Adopt the highest-rated answer/solution to the problem.
Identify next steps and contingencies (if necessary).
Implement the solution.
